intro: Cryptantha micromeres, commonly known as the dwarf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and open woodlands. Its small, tubular leaves and seed pods are adaptations to conserve water in harsh climates. Cryptantha micromeres is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained soils.
